sentences: Meilt eksporditakse teistesse maadesse puitu, elektroonikatooteid jm.
context: The word 'meilt' is in the elative case in Estonian. It comes from the pronoun 'mei' (we) and means 'from us' or 'from our side'. In this context, it's used to indicate that something is exported from Estonia as a country ('from us'). The dictionary definition shows it related to exporting goods abroad - wood, electronic products and other items are exported from Estonia to other countries. It can also be used for exporting ideas.
